document_data.name: Mount Shun
document_data.mainbody: '''Mount Shun''' was a mountain in the [[Po Yul Dzayul Range]] in [[Tabot]], lying northwest of [[U'Chan Gompa]].
document_data.Description: Mount Shun was known to be craggy. It was commonly included in the background of paintings of U'Chan Gompa as part of the Po Yul Dzayul Range, visible in the distance and appearing mysterious.
document_data.Notable Locations: A famed temple of the Tabotan [[Way of Enlightenment]] stood here. It was reputedly where the Holy Mysteries of the faith unfolded, where the [[lance]]s of [[Tabja Rung]] were forged, and where [[demon]]s were defeated.
document_data.History: In {{YearlinkConvert|2607|SY}}, lightning reportedly blasted the image of [[H'Dang Li]], the first High Lord of Oceans of Tabot, into an altar in the temple on Mount Shun, during ceremonies at the end of an annual [[pilgrim]]age. The lamas who witnessed it declared it a sign of his special favor and thus demanded privileges, but rivals were suspicious of this miracle.<ref>
